But shoulder size and height can vary a lot from person to person, meaning one side sleeper might need a lofty pillow while another needs just a little lift.

The Coop pillow (our pick for best pillow overall) is ideal for side sleepers because it offers a lot of customization to help fill that gap, which is why we also named it top overall pick in our guide to the best pillow for side sleepers. But if you're not a memory foam fan, your next best bet is the Casper Original Pillow. 

Made from down-alternative hypoallergenic fill with a percale cotton shell, the Casper pillow feels a lot like the soft, plush pillows you'd find in hotel rooms. A 2-inch gusset (the strip of fabric between seams that gives the pillow a more boxy shape) keeps the pillow lofted for the supportive lift that side sleepers require, but the plush fill still provides the "sinking in" sensation when you lay your head down.

Senior home editor Jaclyn Turner has slept on the Casper Original Pillow for over a year. She is a combo sleeper between back and side sleeping and most appreciates how it has never lost its loft and provides the plush support she craves. 

Another one of the side sleepers who tried the pillow over several weeks also loved that it stayed cool throughout the night and kept its shape despite its softer fill. If you want a balance of support and softness, we recommend giving the Casper Original Pillow a try; just keep in mind that it's not as customizable or adjustable as other pillows.

Read our full review of the Casper Original Pillow.

Best budget

If you're the type of person who can fall asleep just about anywhere or you're primarily concerned about price, the Beckham Hotel Collection Gel Pillow is the best bang for your buck. 

These pillows are on the thinner side but have a gentle, down-like plushness that sets them apart from other inexpensive pillows I've tried. While they're more squishy than supportive, they're a good choice for stomach sleepers, back sleepers, and anyone who likes to hug, fold, or stack their pillows at night.

I've spent several months sleeping with these pillows on and off, and they haven't gone flat or gotten lumpy. They are a little less lofty and bouncy than when I first got them, but I like that they have a more lived-in feel. 

"Gel pillow" is a bit of a misnomer; there's no liquid or cooling gel in these pillows like there is in some other cooling pillows. Instead, these pillows are filled with hypoallergenic polyester gel fiber, similar to a down alternative in both feel and performance. Compared to denser materials like memory foam, the pillows stay relatively cool but stop short of actively cooling you.

While these pillows aren't adjustable, each pack comes with two pillows, so you can easily stack them to your desired comfort level. The company also offers a 30-day satisfaction guarantee — a rarity for Amazon-only pillow brands.

Best for neck pain

The Layla Kapok Pillow is the best pillow for those who suffer from neck pain that we tested. It's adjustable and forms to your head and neck for a very comfortable night's sleep.

To adjust the pillow, unzip the cover and internal case. Remove the fill until you reach your preferred loft (or height). Have a sealable container handy so you contain the fill and save it in case you want to add it back in later.

That customization makes the Layla Kapok great for many types of sleepers. Reporter James Brains preferred to use the pillow with all the fill inside, while Sally Kaplan, executive editor for Insider Reviews, removed two-thirds of the material.

This made it easy to mold the pillow to support her head and neck. Kaplan said it took a few nights to get the fill level right, but then she slept much better than with her old memory foam pillow.

The pillow is made of CertiPUR-US-certified shredded memory foam and fibers from the Kapok tree. The fibers are light, buoyant, and commonly used as a down alternative. The foam is hypoallergenic and made without ozone depleters, certain heavy metals, and formaldehyde.

If you find the pillow doesn't work for you, you can return it within 120 days.

Check out our guide to the best pillow for neck pain for more options.

I kept coming back to this pillow throughout testing, and it quickly became my go-to for nights when I wasn't actively testing anything new.

I've now been sleeping on this pillow for five months. I love how my head sinks into this soft pillow, but it's still supportive enough to keep its shape all night long. When I wake up, the pillow looks just as plush as when I fell asleep.

I'm a very active sleeper who likes to move around a lot in bed and take my bedding with me, so I love that the pillow is equally plush and comfortable from all sides and angles. It's still soft and supportive when I inevitably fold it, scoop it, or hug it throughout the night. It's dense but quickly goes back to its original shape. Finally, it's hypoallergenic, which is a must for allergy sufferers like myself. 

Multiple stomach sleepers who tried the pillow as part of our testing found it too lofty, even with the inner core removed. Some side sleepers might also find the pillow not quite lofty enough; we think it's best for back sleepers and those who prefer a plusher, cooler feel than memory foam.

We purchased four of these pillows a little over a year ago, and they were our mainstay before I started testing and evaluating pillows for this guide. In many ways, this pillow hits all the marks for me: it stays cool, is incredibly soft and comfortable, and is hypoallergenic. While the fill is thin enough that the pillow easily folds over for some support if you occasionally flip to your side or back during the night, it doesn't provide enough for those who spend most of the night in those positions. The pillow also won't offer much lift if you're looking to prop yourself up to read or watch TV while lounging in bed. Still, it's a great personal pillow for any stomach sleeper who has found other pillows too lofty.

Down makes for a very soft and comfortable pillow, but the material isn't for everyone. The mid has a dual chamber design with a feather core for support and is surrounded by fluffy down clusters at a ratio of 30% down to 70% feathers. The down compressed easily but bounced back up quickly and was easy to fluff up. This pillow had the most noticeable down smell of all the down pillows, but it did dissipate. Otherwise, we were pleased with the construction and feel of the pillow.

Hotels make a business out of comfortable sleep, so it's no surprise that "hotel-like" is a term often used to describe an ideal pillow texture. Buckwheat hulls are a traditional pillow fill used in Japan and many other Asian countries. Neither my husband nor I grew up with this type of pillow, so testing the Turmerry Sobakawa Buckwheat Pillow was a new experience for us.

And wow, we were both completely blown away by how comfortable this pillow was — so much so that I purchased an additional one because my husband and I would fight over who got to sleep on it each night.

The sensation of the hulls can take a little getting used to if this type of pillow is new to you. They rustle a bit and add some texture to the pillow. But I just love how malleable and yet supportive the pillow is.

Most nights, I mold the pillow to the shape of my neck and feel totally supported the whole night. The hulls are heavier than a standard pillow fill, yet I can comfortably tuck my arm underneath it without creating too much pressure or overheating.

item.title: The 38 best gifts for any type of boss in 2024
item.description: The best gifts for bosses range from handy desk accessories to useful subscriptions, and are both thoughtful yet appropriate.
item.content:encoded:
When you buy through our links, Business Insider may earn an affiliate commission. Learn more

It's not easy picking out a gift for your boss. You've got to strike a balance between thoughtfulness and appropriateness, without breaking the bank, of course. We've got you covered to make sure you pick out the best gift for your boss, no matter their preferences. 

A subscription that delivers the best teas or coffees to their door

Atlas Tea Club Subscription

This subscription sends them delicious, unique single-origin teas or coffees from the best regions in the world for three months. It'll make each day just a little more pleasant.

A desk sign with a hint of humor

Lasercrafting Desk Name Plates

If you and your boss have a humorous rapport going, they could get a kick out of this witty take on the everyday office signage. Plus, the sleek wooden and gold design let the sign speak for itself without appearing overly kitschy. 

A sweet surprise delivered right to their inbox

Sugarwish Treat Boxes

Sugarwish's business model is simple: You pick the number of treats they receive, the recipient gets an email inviting them to select their favorite treats, and their selected treats are shipped directly to them. It's a practically foolproof gift for a boss because everyone loves candy, and you don't have to go through the awkwardness of figuring out their address. 

A sweatshirt that's also a blanket

The Comfy Original

Why is it that all offices always get freezing cold? This is the ideal gift for the boss who always complains about the office temperature. It's a plush wearable blanket they can curl up in whenever they need some extra warmth.

A cushion to make their desk chair more comfortable

Purple Royal Seat Cushion

Whether they're working from home or in the office every day, spending hours sitting in a chair can get uncomfortable fast. This supportive, cooling seat cushion turns even the hardest of chairs into a plush, soft place to sit.

A leather business card holder

Leatherology Business Card Case

First impressions matter, which is why they should be pulling out business cards from a handsome leather case. It has a no-fuss, invisible magnetic closure and can hold up to 20 cards. Choose from pebbled or smooth leathers in a variety of colors, or upgrade to premium leather. You can also add a monogram for an additional $10. 

The best pens for their office

Muji Gel Ink Ball Point Pens

Muji's fine 0.38mm tip pen is a cult favorite — including among our teammates. According to the company, the water-based ink enables smooth writing, minimal bleeding, and a mechanism that helps keep the ink from drying out. If they write handwritten notes for work, they may have an outsized appreciation for this small but impactful upgrade. They're sold out on Muji, but you can still find them on Amazon.

A tool to relieve muscle tension

Buddy Back Buddy Elite

After hunching over a computer all day long, most of us could use something to get rid of all those knots and muscle tension. This handheld massaging tool will give them some quick relief, whether at home or at their desk.

Fresh and funny sticky notes

Knock Knock To Accomplish Stick Notes Packet

Office supplies may not sound like the most exciting gift around, but these sticky notes are anything but boring. From lighthearted and humorous to straight-up sassy, you're sure to find a set of these sticky notes that will make your boss laugh– and help keep them organized. 

Their very own "The Office" mug

"The Office" Mug

Remember when Kelly threw a party in "The Office," gave out mugs like these as party favors, and quietly exacted revenge against Dwight and Jim for missing it? Well, if your boss is a fan of "The Office," they'll appreciate having their very own version of one.

A box of snacks from around the world

Universal Yums Yum Yum Gift Box

Level up their desk snack situation with a curated box of snacks from a country across the globe. Universal Yums creates snack boxes inspired by different cultures so they can taste-test their way around the world.

A set of fancy olive oils

Graza 'Drizzle' & 'Sizzle' Extra Virgin Olive Oil

If your boss is always talking about the delectable dishes they whipped up over the weekend, this set of high-quality olive oils from Graza will be a winner. The finishing and cooking oils, named Drizzle and Sizzle respectively, are made from fresh Picual olives in Spain and come in squeezable bottles for ease of use. 

A mini humidifier to make their space more comfortable

Pure Enrichment MistAire Cloud Mist Humidifier

Dry air can make any workspace uncomfortable. This cute cloud-shaped humidifier will make their workspace more pleasant with a constant mist that runs for 24 hours, making it easier to breathe all day long.

A classic Moleskine notebook

Moleskine Classic Hard Cover Large Notebook

There's a reason Moleskine notebooks have been so popular for so long; they're quite durable and great quality. Whether your boss always needs paper on hand to take notes during team meetings or is known to keep a log of all of their genius business ideas, a new notebook is sure to get plenty of use. 

A cool calendar

Rifle Paper Co. 2025 Greetings From Around The World Calendar

Running a team comes with a lot of bookkeeping, deadlines, and logistics. A calendar that lets them step back and see the activities they need to do not just on one specific day, but in one week, one month, and one year overall is sure to help keep them organized.

A mystery box of mini plants

Rooted Baby Mystery Jungle Book

Spruce up their desk setup with the gift of plants. These ones are adorably miniature, so they can really be placed anywhere to add a pop of vibrant color. 

A personalized video message from their favorite celebrity

item.description: The best oven liners save you clean-up time and keep your appliances in pristine condition. Here are our top-rated reusable and disposable oven liners.
item.content:encoded:
When you buy through our links, Business Insider may earn an affiliate commission. Learn more

After spending hours on a holiday feast, the last thing you want to do is clean your oven. Thankfully, the best oven liners can live on the bottom rack of your oven and ease the burden of this necessary chore by catching drips, burned bits, and other cooking debris. Every liner is different, so read the instructions carefully to ensure the one you choose is compatible with your oven type. Wrong placement can cause a dangerous reaction between the oven and the liner. 

We found the best oven liners for all oven types, plus options made from heavy-duty materials, customizable mats, and more. Our top pick is the MyHomyline Oven Liners, which work well in a variety of oven types and sizes. If you want a disposable option, the DCS Deals Foil Liners come in a 10-pack and are more durable than aluminum foil.

If you're using your air fryer more than the oven these days, check out the best silicone air fryer liners.

Our top picks for toven liners

Best overall: MyHomyline Oven Liners - See at Amazon

Best for electric ovens: Cooks Innovations Non-Stick Oven Liner - See at Amazon

Best for gas ovens: Grill Magic Premium Extra Thick Oven Liners - See at Amazon

Best for fan ovens: ThreadNanny Heavy-Duty Teflon Oven Liners - See at Amazon

Best disposable: DCS Deals 10-Pack Disposable Foil Oven Liners - See at Amazon

Best overall

Made from non-stick fiberglass fabric, this eco-friendly oven liner suits different oven types, including gas, electric, and convection ovens. It comes with two 23- by 16.2-inch silicone liners that can easily be cut to fit just about any oven's bottom rack. Its Teflon coating helps it withstand up to 500 degrees. You can also use this multi-functional liner as a baking mat or grill mat. These oven liners are dishwasher safe.

Another great option are the slightly more expensive but PFOA-free Linda's Essentials Oven Liners.

Best for electric ovens

This simple, but effective non-stick mat will save you time and money. It's easy to slide in and out of the oven while cooking. Electric ovens are the only oven type where you can place oven liners directly onto the oven floor. However, unless your electric oven has a visible coil heating element, you should still lay this liner on the bottom oven rack for safety; many modern ovens have hidden heating elements below the oven floor. Measuring 16.5 by 23 inches, this liner easily catches hot oven drips and spills. It's safe up to 500 degrees, but don't forget to remove it before using any self-cleaning settings.

Best for gas ovens

This three-piece set of thick oven liners is multi-functional but especially great for gas ovens. Measuring 23 by 16.25 inches, these are the best liners to easily trim and fit around vents so you can ensure airflow. Be sure to include a one-inch gap between the oven and any surrounding vents. These liners also work well on stovetop burners because they are made with a heat-resistant, extra-thick material that can withstand close fire, as well as up to 500 degrees in the oven. They are also dishwasher-safe for easy reuse. 

Best for fan ovens

Some thin mats flap around every time you open and close the oven door, but this heavy-duty, two-piece set combats that problem thanks to its thick Teflon construction. It's also tested to FDA standards, so you can cook food directly on the liner without having to worry about any added flavor or smells. At 17 by 25 inches, it should fit most standard ovens, but if not, you can also easily cut it to your preference. It's safe up to 500 degrees. 

Best disposable

If you're making a big dinner and don't have time to clean between dishes, this 10-pack of disposable foil oven liners is a convenient way to keep the oven in tip-top shape. These liners are a durable and safer alternative to aluminum foil that you can use on the bottom oven rack. Measuring 18.5 by 15.5 inches, each sheet is big enough to catch falling food, but small enough to easily fit a variety of oven sizes. Although disposable, this pack should last you a few months. These are safe to use up to 450 degrees.

What to look for in an oven liner

Oven liners are straightforward kitchen products, but there are a few basic considerations that will help you get the most out of one.

Ease of cleaning: If you're buying a reusable oven liner, you want one that keeps its shape and texture while undergoing regular cleaning. Thicker ones usually hold up better than thinner ones, but the tradeoff is more heat deflection.

Dimensions: Most liners are somewhat customizable in that you can cut them to fit your oven. Just make sure it's not covering the edges where air exchange is necessary.

Materials: There are always trade offs, but always check that the liner you choose is compatible with the oven in which you're placing it. Fiberglass and silicone are the most durable, but they may affect how long it takes for your oven to heat up. You'll get convenience and an unaffected oven temperature with thinner and disposable liners, though you can't use them at the higher heats.

Oven liner FAQs

Are oven liners safe for all ovens?

Yes, but check that the liner is compatible with your type of oven. You also want to make sure that you stay below the maximum temperature rating for the oven liner you buy. While most oven liners are safe to 500 degrees Fahrenheit, broiling can be risky, and most manufacturers recommend removing your oven liner to do so.

Can you bake on an oven liner?

Yes, some oven liners double as baking or grill mats. Check the manufacturer guidelines for the top oven-safe temperature and any other safety warnings. While you're at it, take a look at the best baking sheets to cover all your baking needs.

Where should my oven liner be placed?

Your oven liner should be placed on the bottom rack of your oven unless you have an electric oven, in which case it can go on the oven floor. Confirm with the instruction manuals of both your oven and the liner.

Are oven liners the same as oven mats?

Yes, oven liners and mats perform the same function, but it's more important to know whether or not they may also be used as baking or grilling mats.

item.title: Which Fire TV is best for you? A breakdown of Amazon's streaming sticks, televisions, and Cube device.
item.description: Amazon's Fire TV devices offer convenient access to popular streaming apps. The lineup includes streaming sticks and full-fledged smart TVs.
item.content:encoded:
When you buy through our links, Business Insider may earn an affiliate commission. Learn more

The best Amazon Fire TV devices deliver a reliable streaming experience with access to popular video apps and Alexa voice search. Fire TV products are some of our favorite streaming solutions thanks to their speedy performance and affordable prices. Right now, you can choose between stick, cube, and full-fledged smart TV models. 

Entry-level Fire TV options, like the standard Fire TV Stick, offer HD playback, while the best Fire TV devices, like the second-gen Fire TV Stick 4K Max, support Ultra HD video and Dolby Vision for enhanced color and contrast. Amazon also sells its own smart TVs that have the Fire TV operating system (OS) built in. Though these sets don't rank among the top TVs you can buy, they're decent budget options for fans of Amazon's ecosystem.  

But with so many different Fire TV models to consider, it can be tricky to determine which is right for your needs. To help you pick the best Fire Stick or display for your setup, we've detailed all the ins and outs of each model.

How to get a great deal on the best Fire TV devices

The best Fire Sticks and smart TVs get big deals during major sales events like Amazon Prime Day, though smaller deals pop up throughout the year. The next opportunity to get a great discount on a Fire TV device will be during Black Friday on November 29 and Cyber Monday on December 2.

Fire TV Stick Lite

The Fire TV Stick Lite is the most affordable of the lineup, making it the best Fire Stick on a budget. Like the company's other stick models, this compact dongle plugs into your TV's HDMI port. Once powered on, you can navigate through the stick's interface to access all of the best streaming services. 

The Fire TV Stick Lite matches the video quality of the more expensive standard Fire TV Stick. The only notable difference between this model and the regular Stick is its remote. The Lite includes an Alexa Voice Remote Lite, which lacks TV controls, like power and volume buttons. Other than that, both models are essentially the same.

The Fire TV Stick Lite can stream videos at up to 1080p resolution, which makes it ideal for an HDTV. The device also supports high dynamic range (HDR) using the HDR10 and HDR10+ formats. This feature delivers enhanced colors and contrast when streaming HDR videos through apps like Disney Plus. That said, most TVs that support HDR are 4K models, and if you have a 4K TV, we highly recommend you pay a bit more for one of Amazon's 4K sticks.

If your TV doesn't support 4K, the Fire TV Stick Lite will suit your streaming needs just fine. However, keep in mind that the standard Fire TV Stick occasionally goes on sale for even less than the Lite. When that happens, there's no reason to consider this model.

Fire TV Stick

The standard Fire TV Stick matches the 1080p and HDR streaming quality of the Lite model but has an improved remote with TV controls like power and volume. Though it usually costs $10 more than the Lite model, it's sometimes on sale for less than that entry-level option. 

The base Fire TV Stick will meet most people's HD streaming needs, but if you own a 4K TV, we recommend spending the extra money on one of Amazon's more advanced 4K streaming devices.

Fire TV Stick 4K

As the name suggests, the Fire TV Stick 4K streams at a higher resolution than the Fire TV Stick or Stick Lite. With 4K support, you'll get a sharper, more detailed image when watching 4K videos on a 4K TV.

This model also carries over HDR playback but adds support for the more advanced Dolby Vision format, which is missing on the Lite and standard Fire TV Stick. Dolby Vision can give your TV more detailed guidance for displaying HDR images, but only when watching Dolby Vision content on a compatible display. Check out our HDR TV guide for more details about different HDR formats.

The latest version of the Fire TV Stick 4K was released in September 2023. It has a slightly tweaked design with rounded edges, more memory, and an improved processor. Amazon says it's around 25% faster than the first-gen model. It also now supports WiFi 6 when used with a compatible router. 

The Fire TV Stick 4K is also one of the few Fire TV models with access to the Xbox app. With the Xbox app, a Game Pass Ultimate membership, and a Bluetooth controller, you can stream Xbox games to your Fire TV Stick 4K. This means you can play high-end games without a console.  

All things considered, this model is a good fit for those with a 4K TV. However, if you're willing to spend a bit more, the Fire TV Stick 4K Max offers slightly better performance.

Fire TV Stick 4K Max

The Fire TV Stick 4K Max is one of our picks for the best streaming devices you can buy. It carries over everything you get with the regular Fire TV Stick 4K while offering a faster processor and GPU, as well as more storage. This makes navigation a little snappier and lets you save more apps and games.

Amazon released the latest version of its Fire TV Stick 4K Max in September 2023. Compared to the previous-generation edition, this new model has an upgraded processor, double the amount of storage, and support for WiFi 6E routers. It also has a revised design with rounded edges.

Unlike other Fire TV Sticks, the 4K Max supports Amazon's Fire TV Ambient Experience, which lets you display art, photos, and widgets for things like the weather and your calendar. And like the standard Fire TV Stick 4K, it also supports the Xbox app for Game Pass streaming.

The Fire TV Stick 4K Max is typically just $10 more than the standard Fire TV Stick 4K, so we think it's the best Fire TV option for people with 4K TVs.

Fire TV Cube

The Fire TV Cube is the best Fire TV for pure processing power. It incorporates all of the key features of the Fire TV Stick 4K Max but has a beefier CPU and is meant to be a more traditional home theater device. Instead of a dongle that hangs out of your TV's HDMI port, the Cube is a compact box that sits on your TV stand and plugs into your display with an HDMI cable. 

One of the Fire TV Cube's biggest benefits is its support for hands-free Alexa voice control without a remote. In other words, the Cube can act like an Echo device. The newest model also has an HDMI passthrough port to control cable boxes, twice as much storage space as the stick models, 4K upscaling to make HD videos look better, and overall faster performance.

The Fire TV Cube is a premium streaming box designed to compete with devices like the Apple TV 4K, Roku Ultra, and Google TV Streamer. It's best suited for home theater enthusiasts who want the brand's absolute best quality and fastest technology.

Fire TV 2-Series

Amazon also sells its own lineup of full-fledged smart TVs, which all use a built-in version of the Fire TV OS. This means you can stream your favorite apps without an extra device. Though Amazon's displays don't make our guide to the best TVs, they're still worthwhile budget options if you're a fan of the Fire TV ecosystem. The 2-Series is Amazon's entry-level HDTV model designed for people who just want a basic smart TV for casual viewing. 

The 2-Series is available in a 32-inch 720p screen or 40-inch 1080p screen. Both models support HDR processing using the standard HDR10 format, but the 2-Series can't deliver the brightness or color needed to really take advantage of high-dynamic-range playback. For this reason, we only recommend this model for people who want a cheap TV that doesn't take up too much space.

Fire TV 4-Series

The 4-Series steps things up from HD to Ultra HD with a 4K resolution screen. Models are available in 43-, 50-, and 55-inch sizes. 

Though it supports 4K playback, the 4-Series has subpar HDR performance and lacks advanced features like wide color support and Dolby Vision. It's a decent TV for buyers who want a smaller, affordable 4K display for a bedroom, but it's not suited for home theater use. 

Fire TV Omni Series

The Omni Series Fire TV adds support for hands-free Alexa voice control without using the remote. You can control power, volume, navigation, and search with spoken commands through the TV's built-in microphones. And the TV can also serve as an Alexa smart home hub even when the display is off. 

Models range in size from 43 to 75 inches. Every model supports 4K resolution and HDR10, and the 65- and 75-inch models add support for Dolby Vision.

Unfortunately, the TV's picture quality and navigation speed are underwhelming for its price. There are simply better-looking displays from brands like TCL, Hisense, and Roku that cost around the same. That said, the Omni is a decent buy when it's on sale during deal events like Black Friday and Prime Day. We only recommend picking up the 65-inch model when you can snag it for under $500. 

Check out our Amazon Fire TV Omni review.

Fire TV Omni QLED Series

Amazon's Omni QLED is the best Fire TV display you can buy, and it offers a big step up from the regular Omni Series. It carries over hands-free Alexa support while adding advanced picture features like quantum dots and local dimming. These features enable it to deliver much better color and contrast performance. 

The TV also has an ambient mode that can display art and widgets when it senses someone has walked into the room. Sizes range from 43 to 75 inches, but the 43-inch model does not include local dimming.

The 65-inch model's list price of $800 is high for what you get, and the set doesn't match the overall performance of the very best 4K TVs in this class. However, we've seen it drop to $600 during big sales events, offering much better value at that price. 

Check out our full Amazon Fire TV Omni QLED review and our guide to all of the best smart TVs.

Fire TV Soundbar

Amazon's latest Fire TV-branded product isn't actually a streaming device at all. Instead, it's a soundbar.

The Fire TV soundbar is a compact 2.0-channel speaker designed to rest in front of your TV. It features an HDMI eARC and optical port for easy connection to most modern displays, and it also supports Bluetooth for wireless music playback from a mobile device.

At 24 inches wide, the soundbar is relatively small, which should make it easy to set up on most TV stands. Though it doesn't include a subwoofer or offer advanced features like up-firing audio drivers with Dolby Atmos support, the Fire TV Soundbar does support DTS Virtual:X to simulate surround sound. That said, at this price range and performance class, buyers shouldn't expect too much from this feature.  

And despite the Fire TV branding, this is a soundbar only. It does not feature built-in support for streaming video apps. The base model only includes a standard remote, but you can pay more for a package with an Alexa Voice Remote Pro. 

Based on the specs and affordable $120 price tag, Amazon is positioning this as an entry-level soundbar for people who just want a simple, compact, and inexpensive upgrade for their TV's speakers.

item.title: The 16 best affordable skincare brands our beauty editors love
item.description: Get luxury-tier products at a fraction of the price with our picks of the best affordable skincare brands like Maelove, Cocokind, and The Ordinary.
item.content:encoded:
When you buy through our links, Business Insider may earn an affiliate commission. Learn more

The days of unimpressive drugstore skincare are behind us. These days, the best affordable skincare brands are stepping up formulations, innovation, and originality without sacrificing budget-friendly prices. Even more impressive, plenty of our favorite affordable skincare brands, like Maelove, Cocokind, and The Ordinary, to name a few, perform as well or even better than luxury skincare products.

If you're looking for products designed for sensitive skin or need potent exfoliators and actives to amp up your glow, our team of beauty experts is here to test new products for their quality and value, so you don't have to. We cherry-picked a list of affordable skincare brands that carry effective skincare and are definitely worth your time and dollar.

Here are 16 affordable skincare brands you should know about:

Maelove

Maelove is a relatively new skincare founded by a group of MIT graduates. They set out to create simple, effective skincare products without compromising luxury quality. That's why they formulate products for all skin types in the same high-end cosmetics labs luxury brands use.

Its cult-favorite $32.95 vitamin C serum (which consumers have pointed out is very similar to SkinCeuticals' $182 version) put the company on the map and is prone to frequent sellouts.

Read our review of the Maelove Glow Maker Serum, our review of the Maelove NIA 10 Calming Serum, and our team's full review of Maelove skincare.

Cocokind

Cocokind is an affordable skincare line that puts superfood-focused, sustainable values into its products. Each product is certified organic and doesn't feature a long scroll of ingredients. We love the brand's attention to customer reviews and interests, often reformulating and ideating to create the best product possible. We love the MyMatcha Moisture Stick for on-the-go hydration and the Vitamin C Glow Serum for brightening and firming. But you can't go wrong with any of their natural formulas.

Read our full review of Cocokind skincare.

The Ordinary

The Ordinary is a well-loved, affordable skincare brand known for "clinical formulations with integrity." In other words, it uses familiar, effective clinical technologies with transparent communication and pricing. The Ordinary's new Soothing and Barrier Support Serum, or "pink serum" as TikTok calls it, is a blend of vitamins, lipids, and soothing Centella to rejuvenate the skin and reduce signs of redness. Most products range from as little as $6 to as much as $30. With their super simple ingredients and excellent results, The Ordinary is a go-to brand for building out your skincare routine with basics.

Read our review of The Ordinary AHA + BHA Peel, our review of The Ordinary Niacinamide + Zinc serum, and our team's full review of The Ordinary.

Naturium

Naturium launched in February 2020 and took the skincare scene by storm. Founded by beauty expert and YouTube guru Susan Yara, the formulations are rooted in a clinically effective and scientific approach. She wanted to create a line dedicated to teaching customers important skincare ingredient knowledge through the ingredient library on the Naturium website. Every product launch feels intentional, and the brand develops product lines that assist with particular skin concerns like fine lines or uneven skin tone.

The brand's best-selling products are pretty much endless, but the Vitamin C Complex Serum and Multi-Peptide Moisturizer are some major fan favorites. Not to mention, the TikTok-viral Café Collection, which has four gorgeous nude-tinted Phyto-Glow Lip Balms, is one of the best lip balms we've tried.

COSRX

This Korean skincare brand took the industry by storm with its use of a controversial ingredient:  snail mucin — a snail secretion filtrate that has been shown to plump, hydrate, and soothe the skin. Now, if that doesn't intrigue you, we've tried COSRX's Advanced Snail Mucin line and have been left with deeply nourished skin after just a few weeks of use. They're an affordable skincare brand surely climbing their way to holy-grail status.

The INKEY List

Like The Ordinary, The INKEY List strives to educate consumers through simple yet effective skincare and marketing. Their products are low-cost but certainly high-performing, with many winning beauty awards. Our favorites are their basic staples like the Hyaluronic Acid Serum and BHA Serum which both easily fit into any skincare routine.

Farmacy

Farmacy makes relatively affordable farm-to-face skincare that combines effective natural ingredients with scientific advancements. One of our favorite collections is the Honey line, featuring powerful products like the Honey Glow resurfacing serum and the intensely hydrating, antioxidant-rich Honey Drop Cream.

Read our review of the Farmacy Green Clean Makeup Removing Cleansing Balm and our review of the Farmacy Honey Potion Renewing Antioxidant Hydration Mask.

Mario Badescu

Mario Badescu, founded in 1967 by the European facialist, is the brand behind the popular acne spot drying lotion that everyone from beauty editors to supermodels like Bella Hadid and Kylie Jenner swear by. Badescu products have a potent combination of the usual scientific suspects as well as botanicals. 

Read our review of the Mario Badescu Drying Lotion.

Neutrogena

Neutrogena has been a trusted drugstore brand for years. Their classics, like the Norwegian Formula Hand Cream, remain staples in our routines, but they've recently expanded formulas to feature some holy-grail ingredients. Their Hydro Boost line is one of our favorites, focused on the hydrating effects of hyaluronic acid. Each product offers lightweight gel textures that leave the skin glowing.

Acure

Acure is making a name for itself as the 100% vegan and "0% pretentious" brand for skin, hair, and body products. You won't find any parabens, sulfates, mineral oils, petrolatum, silicones, or animal testing — and the Brightening Facial Scrub, which works on all skin types and uses a chlorella growth factor to stimulate new cell growth, has over 3,000 five-star reviews on Amazon. 

Read our review of the Acure Seriously Soothing Cleansing Cream.

Hero Cosmetics

Hero Cosmetics makes Hydrocolloid patches that draw pus from pimples, resulting in noticeably minimized and less inflamed blemishes overnight. The treatment was initially used to treat wounds, but it has gained popularity lately as an answer to acne.

Here's how it works: Place a sticker on top of a blemish and remove it after a few hours or overnight wear. In a nutshell, it's an overnight miracle product. Multiple Insider Reviews reporters credit the Mighty Patch as the only quick fix worth its money — and one we earnestly wish had existed years before. 

Read our team's full review of Hero Cosmetics hydrocolloid patches.

Cerave

Developed by dermatologists, CeraVe is another excellent standardized skincare system. The hero ingredients in each one of the brand's products are ceramides, which help maintain the skin's barrier, making it soft, moisturized, and protected against irritation and air pollution.

Read our review of the Cerave Hydrating Facial Cleanser, one of our favorite products from the brand.

Cetaphil

Cetaphil is a favorite brand among our minimalist colleagues and many dermatologists we confer with for articles. The brand specializes in simple, universal formulas — and they work well. It's a great affordable brand to try if you're just beginning to delve into the world of skincare with their easy-to-use, no-frills products. 

Every Man Jack

Every Man Jack is one of the few grooming brands that prioritizes being eco-friendly. With 97% of the ingredients in its body wash being naturally derived, the brand uses as many clean ingredients as possible without limiting its effectiveness. Not to mention, each of their products has an intoxicating and soothing scent that leaves you smelling good all day.

Read our review of the Every Man Jack subscription.

Aveeno

Aveeno was built on the philosophy that natural ingredients and science-backed formulations develop nourishing, solution-oriented products. In our experience, Aveeno makes one of the best affordable body moisturizers: the Daily Moisturizing Body Lotion. It's hydrating, packed with nutrients, and is an accessible price point. We've found that our skin feels hydrated for hours with a noticeable "glow" throughout the day. It's also lightweight and fast-absorbing, so it's the perfect lotion for after a shower.

Brickell Men's Products

After finding their options lacking, Josh Meyer and Matt Bolduc founded Brickell Men's Products to introduce a premium men's skincare line that uses natural and organic ingredients. The products are almost all standouts, but we especially love the Purifying Charcoal Face Wash for its ability to deep-clean pores and leave a refreshing and invigorating sensation without any of the harsh chemicals.

Read our team's full review of Brickell Men's Products.
